title: Digital Exhibit Lab
description: Digital Exhibit Lab is designed to teach digital scholarship concepts and critical literacies via a hands-on experience creating a digital collection. Students are invited to do archival research, curation, description, and metadata, resulting in a final published digital exhibit website.
author: Evan Williamson

title: Oral History as Data
description: Using the Oral History as Data tool as a foundation, this module will walk you through the preparation, coding, and configuration needed to build and visualize a digital collection of interviews.
author: Devin Becker

title: Writing with Visualizations
description: The Writing with Visualizations project template facilitates the publication of multimedia web essays that incorporate supporting material in image and document format. The template can also be used to explore text analysis and topic modeling.
topics: text analysis; primary sources; writing for the web
author: Olivia Wikle

title: Lesson Template
description: A minimal Jekyll template with sidebar content nav for creating lesson and workshop websites using Markdown
author: Evan Williamson

title: Data Curation
description: A lesson plan and example project that introduces learners to describing and analyzing primary sources and making them publicly available online through CollectionBuilder.
author: Kate Thornhill

title: Static Web Foundations with CollectionBuilder
description: Lesson plans and materials associated with a CollectionBuilder workshop held at the University of Oregon Libraries DREAM Lab.
author: Gabriele Hayden
